page.title: 15Ayston Church, Rutland
page.content: Ayston Church, dedicated to St. Mary the Virgin, is situated on the western edge of the small, rural village of Ayston. The approach to the church is across a small village green, with a row of cottages on one side and a rough hedgerow on the other. The whole area of the church and graveyard is roughly 1200 metres squared. Both the east and west boundaries of the graveyard are marked by iron railings; on the south side there is a holly hedge some 2 metres high. On the north side there is delapidated iron stone wall about 1 metre high. The west side is shadowed by a small spinney of beech trees, whereas on the east there is a characteristic yew bush. The church is dominated by the tower on the west side of the church. The ironstone of the church is covered in lichens.
